revised_title: Investigation of the Absorption Spectra of Benzene and its Homologues
tldr: The author investigated the absorption spectra of benzene and its homologues at different temperatures and pressures, as well as in solutions. They discovered that the mode of vibration within the benzene nucleus is mostly unaffected by side-chain substitution. The study also revealed two types of absorption: general absorption, which is influenced by temperature, and selective absorption, which is best studied by reducing pressure.
